intro: Calcearia speculum, commonly known as the spectacle plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique, eye-like flowers that resemble spectacles. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple and pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calcearia speculum thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Its foliage is typically heart-shaped and glossy, adding to its ornamental value in gardens.
